document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amiota ( Phortica ) linae Máca & Chen in
Máca & Lin, 1993: 177
. syn. nov.

Amiota ( Phortica ) acongruens
Zhang & Shi, 1997: 368
. syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Aedeagal median rod has diverse intraspecific variations distally ( Fig. 11 ), even the specimens from same locality. This species can be distinguished from
P . gamma ( Toda & Peng, 1990 )
by having the posterior bands of male abdominal third to fifth tergites connect to lateral margins ( Fig. 5D ); aedeagal median rod with 1 (occasionally) or 2 pair(s) of processes submedially ( Fig. 11 ).

Specimens examined.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Phortica ( Phortica ) eugamma ( Toda & Peng, 1990 )
, A, B from Diaoluoshan, Hainan, China; C–E from Yixiang, Yunnan, China, male. A. Paramere, aedeagus, gonopod, and aedeagal apodeme (lateral view); B–E. Aedeagal median rod (lateral view). Scale bars = 0.1 mm.
